p: Recently, LPAIV H9N2 subtype has been isolated worldwide from different types of terrestrial poultry [3], [4]. Initially concentrated in Asia [5], outbreaks subsequently spread to Africa, the Middle East [6], [7], and America [8] causing significant economic losses related to increased mortality and decreased production in poultry industry [9]. It has also been reported that H9N2 avian influenza virus can cross species barrier and infect humans [10].
